contentencoded: There's been a lot of talk this week about the U.S. and its allies staging a military intervention in Syria after increasing evidence of President Assad's regime using deadly chemical weapons against Syrian civilians. The debate over intervention still rages -- as does the civil war in that country. One weapon being used in the conflict is the power to shut down the internet. Mashable reporter Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai has been the latest on this story.
description: Should shutting off the internet be used as a weapon against Syria?
